org.cpsolver.exam.model

Class ExamModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cpsolver.ifs.model.Model<V,T>
      • org.cpsolver.ifs.assignment.context.ModelWithContext<Exam,ExamPlacement,ExamContext>
        • org.cpsolver.exam.model.ExamModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanHoldContext, HasAssignmentContext<Exam,ExamPlacement,ExamContext>

    public class ExamModel
extends ModelWithContext<Exam,ExamPlacement,ExamContext>
    Examination timetabling model. Exams Exam are modeled as variables, rooms ExamRoom and students ExamStudent as constraints. Assignment of an exam to time (modeled as non-overlapping periods ExamPeriod) and space (set of rooms) is modeled using values ExamPlacement. In order to be able to model individual period and room preferences, period and room assignments are wrapped with ExamPeriodPlacement and ExamRoomPlacement classes respectively. Moreover, additional distribution constraint ExamDistributionConstraint can be defined in the model.

    The objective function consists of the following criteria:
    • Direct student conflicts (a student is enrolled in two exams that are scheduled at the same period, weighted by Exams.DirectConflictWeight)
    • Back-to-Back student conflicts (a student is enrolled in two exams that are scheduled in consecutive periods, weighted by Exams.BackToBackConflictWeight). If Exams.IsDayBreakBackToBack is false, there is no conflict between the last period and the first period of consecutive days.
    • Distance Back-to-Back student conflicts (same as Back-to-Back student conflict, but the maximum distance between rooms in which both exam take place is greater than Exams.BackToBackDistance, weighted by Exams.DistanceBackToBackConflictWeight).
    • More than two exams a day (a student is enrolled in three exams that are scheduled at the same day, weighted by Exams.MoreThanTwoADayWeight).
    • Period penalty (total of period penalties PeriodPenalty of all assigned exams, weighted by Exams.PeriodWeight).
    • Room size penalty (total of room size penalties RoomSizePenalty of all assigned exams, weighted by Exams.RoomSizeWeight).
    • Room split penalty (total of room split penalties RoomSplitPenalty of all assigned exams, weighted by Exams.RoomSplitWeight).
    • Room penalty (total of room penalties RoomPenalty of all assigned exams, weighted by Exams.RoomWeight).
    • Distribution penalty (total of distribution constraint weights ExamDistributionConstraint.getWeight() of all soft distribution constraints that are not satisfied, i.e., ExamDistributionConstraint.isSatisfied(Assignment) = false; weighted by Exams.DistributionWeight).
    • Direct instructor conflicts (an instructor is enrolled in two exams that are scheduled at the same period, weighted by Exams.InstructorDirectConflictWeight)
    • Back-to-Back instructor conflicts (an instructor is enrolled in two exams that are scheduled in consecutive periods, weighted by Exams.InstructorBackToBackConflictWeight). If Exams.IsDayBreakBackToBack is false, there is no conflict between the last period and the first period of consecutive days.
    • Distance Back-to-Back instructor conflicts (same as Back-to-Back instructor conflict, but the maximum distance between rooms in which both exam take place is greater than Exams.BackToBackDistance, weighted by Exams.InstructorDistanceBackToBackConflictWeight).
    • Room split distance penalty (if an examination is assigned between two or three rooms, distance between these rooms can be minimized using this criterion)
    • Front load penalty (large exams can be penalized if assigned on or after a certain period)
    Version:
    ExamTT 1.3 (Examination Timetabling)

      • isDayBreakBackToBack

        public boolean isDayBreakBackToBack()
        True when back-to-back student conflict is to be encountered when a student is enrolled into an exam that is on the last period of one day and another exam that is on the first period of the consecutive day. It can be set by problem property Exams.IsDayBreakBackToBack, or in the input xml file, property isDayBreakBackToBack)
        Returns:
        true if last exam on one day is back-to-back to the first exam of the following day
